ml.alternet.security.auth

Interface Hasher

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Credentials.Checker
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Argon2Hasher, BCryptHasher, HasherBase, MD5BasedHasher, MessageHasher, PBKDF2Hasher, PlainTextCryptFormat.PlainTextHasher, SaltedMessageHasher, SHA2Hasher, UnixCryptHasher

    public interface Hasher
extends Credentials.Checker
    Computes/checks a password to/with a crypt.

    Some hasher require a user name, but the more often they won't.

    A hasher is usually available to the discovery service with a variant make from the crypt format family name and the hasher scheme.

    CredentialsChecker supply several means to find a hasher or to check a password.

    This class defines 6 standard parameters.

    Author:
    Philippe Poulard
    See Also:
    CryptFormat, Credentials

      • getBuilder

        Hasher.Builder getBuilder()
        Return the builder used for creating this hasher. Changes made to this builder doesn't affect the configuration of this hasher.
        Returns:

      • encrypt

        String encrypt(Credentials credentials)
        throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Compute a crypt from credentials.

        By default, the user is ignored.

        Parameters:
        credentials - Credentials, that must contain at least the password.
        Returns:
        A crypt.
        Throws:
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - When the hash algorithm fails.

      • encrypt

        default String encrypt(String user,
                       char[] password)
                throws InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Compute a crypt from a password.

        By default, the user is ignored.

        Parameters:
        user - The user name (sometimes required by some hasher), or null
        password - The password.
        Returns:
        A crypt.
        Throws:
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - When the hash algorithm fails.

      • resolve

        static Optional<Hasher> resolve(String crypt,
                                CryptFormat... formats)
        Find the hasher for a given crypt.
        Parameters:
        crypt - The crypt to resolve.
        formats - The list of candidate formats.
        Returns:
        If found, the hasher.

      • compare

        static boolean compare(byte[] a,
                       byte[] b)
        Compare bytes array in length constant time in order to prevent "timing attack".
        Parameters:
        a - A non-null byte array.
        b - A non-null byte array.
        Returns:
        true if all the bytes are equals, false otherwise.

      • compare

        static boolean compare(char[] a,
                       char[] b)
        Compare chars array in length constant time in order to prevent "timing attack".
        Parameters:
        a - A non-null byte array.
        b - A non-null byte array.
        Returns:
        true if all the bytes are equals, false otherwise.
